title: Understanding $$f(x-a)$$
text: For some value a, $$f(x-a)$$ means that f(x) is translated to the right by a units. Similarly, $$f{\left(x+a\right)}$$ means that f(x) is translated to the left by a units.

title: Understanding $$f(x-a)$$

title: Understanding $$f(-x)$$
text: $$f(-x)$$ means that f(x) is reflected across the y-axis. Similarly, $$-f(x)$$ means that f(x) is reflected across the x-axis.
speech: , f of negative x,  means that f(x) is reflected across the y-axis. Similarly,  negative f of x  means that f(x) is reflected across the x-axis.

title: Understanding $$f(-x)$$
text: $$h\left(-x+6\right)$$ means that the graph is reflected across the y-axis.
